poem.title: First Experimental Contact B-Scanner British Patent no. 863.874 (1958)
poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: The youngest foreman plater on the Clyde When his youngest (my father) was three, fell to pneumonia That I, at three, survived to see Pickled freak friends in this curious Cabinet, fossil bones and Roman coins but not Till now the chest for checking Welds at my father's work, rejigged To scry cockle mariners such as My daughter, scanned at the Southern, Now expert in its use, Every bit of this Hunterian, Steam Gothic tor in time The shade of a sound.
